game:This item can not be added to shawa: This item can not be added to shawarmas
game:Can't add more filling - already co: Can't add more filling - already completely filled shawarma
game:heldhelp-placetodoughform: Place on the table to begin kneading the dough.
artofcooking:block-handbooktext-copperpo: See Meal making guide. You cannot eat from a cooking pot directly, you will need a bowl. If you want to empty a bowl or cooking pot without eating the contents, simply toss it in some water!
artofcooking:block-handbooktext-dirtycop: A cooking pot used to cook up glue or other non-food recipes becomes caked in residue. A residue-covered cooking pot cannot be used for meal-making with food ingredients, but is still quite handy for other purposes. A copper pot can be washed by soaking in vinegar for a day.
artofcooking:blockdesc-dirtycopperpot-*: Covered in grime, can no longer be used for meal-making. Can be washed in vinegar.
artofcooking:block-handbooktext-copperbo: See Meal making guide. Fill by rightmouse clicking on a cooking pot, crock, bucket, or other container with food or liquid inside. If you want to empty a bowl or cooking pot without eating the contents, simply toss it in some water!
artofcooking:blockdesc-copperbowl-*: Holds twice as much liquid and meal.
artofcooking:block-handbooktext-spoon: It holds no more than 0.1 servings of a dish, but it gives more saturation. You can take food directly from the bowl.
artofcooking:blockdesc-spoon-*: A cutlery for a more thoughtful and healthy meal.
itemdesc-lavash-*-partbaked: You can add the filling and wrap it in shawarma.
itemdesc-lavash-*-perfect: You can add the filling and wrap it in shawarma.
itemdesc-lavash-*-charred: You can add the filling and wrap it in shawarma.
game:itemdesc-ciderportion-*: It will turn into vinegar when rotting.
